content: I wanted to check in with other tool maintainers if there are any important rust tools that might get neglected or where there might be some technical challenges with the port where I can help out. I've already got cargo taken care of.
rustup comes to mind. afaik rustfmt doesn't use clap (but maybe could)
oh and mdbook is an official tool now, right? probably quite a simple migration tho and I'm not sure who maintains it
pretty sure we're using structopt in rustfmt, so indirectly using clap
In case you missed it, clap 3 is the official upgrade path from structopt 0.3 and our changelog includes how to migrate from structopt and what was breaking since both clap2 and structopt.
ah okay, yeah i wasn't aware so thanks for the heads up!
